decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to speed out Primeval Titan and combo pieces like Scapeshift. By utilizing lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field, the deck aims to generate massive amounts of mana to overwhelm opponents with powerful spells and threats. With the ability to tutor for key pieces with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Summoner's Pact, the deck can quickly assemble its combo and win the game in explosive fashion.

This deck focuses on quickly playing efficient creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to keep pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly. Mishra's Bauble and Preordain help with card selection and keeping the deck moving smoothly. The key is to be aggressive and relentless in attacking the opponent's life total while maintaining card advantage through careful deck manipulation.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and using artifact synergies to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up mana production, while also running artifact-based disruption like Metallic Rebuke and Engineered Explosives. The deck also includes ways to generate card advantage with Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast. With the combination of fast creature deployment, disruption, and card advantage, this Aggro - Affinity deck aims to apply constant pressure and outpace the opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck combines powerful creatures with instant-speed reanimation spells to quickly overwhelm opponents with threats. By using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, players can cheat expensive creatures like Griselbrand onto the battlefield early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to disrupt opponent's strategies, while cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler provide additional value and control options. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all three colors necessary for the deck's spells.

The deck focuses on playing cheap artifacts and creatures to quickly put pressure on the opponent while utilizing cards like Springleaf Drum and Mox Opal to generate mana efficiently. It also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Engineered Explosives to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense. The combination of fast mana generation and aggressive threats make it a formidable opponent in the Modern format.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes control elements like Seasoned Pyromancer and Voice of Victory to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to support a fast and consistent gameplay, with mana fixing cards like Windswept Heath and Arid Mesa. Overall, the deck aims to quickly close out games with efficient creatures and powerful combat tricks.

This deck heavily relies on utilizing the Broodscale creatures to generate value and disrupt opponents with the help of cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Kozilek's Command. It aims to assemble specific combos while controlling the board with creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Walking Ballista. The inclusion of Urza's Saga enhances the deck's ability to tutor for key pieces, making it more consistent. Additionally, the deck utilizes Boseiju, Who Endures to protect key spells from counterspells, giving it resilience against control strategies.

The main focus of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly build a strong, cohesive board presence through the use of merfolk creatures and tribal synergies. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Mistcaller and Tishana's Tidebinder while also maintaining a steady flow of card advantage with Silvergill Adept and Mindspring Merfolk. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, while Lord of Atlantis and Harbinger of the Seas provide additional utility and pressure. The deck's mana base includes Mutavault and Cavern of Souls to ensure smooth, consistent gameplay.

This Aggro - Affinity deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and artifacts to overwhelm the opponent's defenses and disrupt their game plan. The deck utilizes cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to generate mana and enable explosive plays. Key cards like Memnite and Pinnacle Emissary provide early aggression, while cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke help control the board and protect the deck's key threats. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly generate threats and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays, while also disrupt their game plan with cards like Pithing Needle and Engineered Explosives. The deck aims to win through fast damage and efficient equipment like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear, backed up by cards like Tormod's Crypt to disrupt graveyard strategies. The inclusion of cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum provide ramp and mana fixing, allowing the deck to deploy threats quickly and efficiently. The deck's varied threats and disruption elements make it a versatile and powerful choice in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize fast, aggressive creatures such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to quickly overwhelm and outpace the opponent. Supporting cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah help provide additional value and board presence. The inclusion of cards like Voice of Victory and Guide of Souls enhances the synergy among the creatures in the deck. Additionally, using cards like Blood Moon and Arena of Glory can disrupt the opponent's game plan and give the deck an advantage.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on using powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge for additional damage output. The key strategy is to maintain a fast pace of aggression, using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride to apply pressure early on, while also utilizing cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Voice of Victory for additional support and utility. The deck also includes disruption elements like Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on using Flash creatures and instant spells to reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard, such as Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, players can quickly bring back key creatures and overwhelm their opponents with powerful abilities. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to control the game and protect the combo pieces. Overall, the goal is to quickly assemble the combo and outvalue the opponent with powerful reanimation effects and game-winning creatures.

The Jeskai Control deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers to control the board and outvalue opponents. It aims to disrupt opponents' game plans by countering key spells and removing threats, while also generating card advantage through powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. By staying ahead on resources and efficiently answering threats, the deck aims to grind out victories through attrition and eventually close out the game with powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury.

This deck is focused on quickly playing creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. It utilizes cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth to remove blockers and pump up creatures for maximum damage output. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help to dig for more threats and ensure a consistent flow of cards. The mana base is streamlined for efficiency, allowing for quick access to all the necessary colors to cast spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive plays.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to aggressively play low-cost creatures and spells to deal quick and efficient damage to the opponent. Cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler provide early aggression, while cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter offer additional utility. Spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth help in removing threats and finishing off the opponent. Mishra's Bauble and Preordain are used for card selection and deck manipulation. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and relentless attacks, while also incorporating some flexibility with cards like Expressive Iteration.
